content.raw:
I'm having trouble running the examples, because `ign-gazebo` seems to be killing itself a short while after the debug line

```
[GUI] [Dbg] [gui_main.cc:186] Requesting list of world names. The server may be busy downloading resources. Please be patient.
```

It seems to be happening on all the world files that I try to load, so I’m guessing I’ve checked out the wrong branch of some ignition package.

That being said, I think the `Set pose repeatedly` for two free groups is working as intended. If you watch it closely, the moment before the faded box “disappears”, it has wound up in a pose that is far “beneath” \(has a significant negative z value in\) the frame of the bright red box. I think what’s happening is the faded box ends up underneath the ground plane, which makes it seem like it’s disappeared, but in reality it’s probably either falling off to negative infinity, getting launched into outer space, or getting stuck in the ground depending on how the extreme violation of the plane collision constraint is being handled.
content.html:
I'm having trouble running the examples, because ign-gazebo seems to be killing itself a short while after the debug line

[GUI] [Dbg] [gui_main.cc:186] Requesting list of world names. The server may be busy downloading resources. Please be patient.

It seems to be happening on all the world files that I try to load, so I’m guessing I’ve checked out the wrong branch of some ignition package.

That being said, I think the Set pose repeatedly for two free groups is working as intended. If you watch it closely, the moment before the faded box “disappears”, it has wound up in a pose that is far “beneath” (has a significant negative z value in) the frame of the bright red box. I think what’s happening is the faded box ends up underneath the ground plane, which makes it seem like it’s disappeared, but in reality it’s probably either falling off to negative infinity, getting launched into outer space, or getting stuck in the ground depending on how the extreme violation of the plane collision constraint is being handled.
